why_invisible: Quarterly NAVs instead of daily pricing
No public credit ratings on most deals
PIK provisions mask cash flow problems
SEC Form PF aggregated with 60-day lag

our_proxies.most_reliable: BDC price/NAV discounts - daily market signal
corroborating: PE firm stock prices (KKR, BX, APO)

historical_validation.2008_gfc: BDCs fell 50%+ before private credit losses recognized
historical_validation.2020_covid: BDCs dropped 40% in March, recovered faster than private NAVs
historical_validation.2022_rates: BDC discounts widened 3-6 months before PC distress headlines

limitations: Public proxies may not capture sector-specific stress
BDCs focus on middle market; mega-cap private credit less visible
SLOOS quarterly frequency means 90-day data lag
PE stocks affected by non-credit factors
market_context.integration_with_mac:
Private Credit score can be integrated as a 7th pillar or as a
        sub-component of the Credit pillar. Recommended weight: 10-15%
        of total MAC score when data is available.
        
        Key insight: Private credit stress typically manifests 3-6 months
        BEFORE public market stress because:
        1. Private credit borrowers are weaker credits
        2. Refinancing wall hits them first
        3. Sponsors pull support before public distress

warnings: ELEVATED: C&I lending to small firms tightening at 55%
ELEVATED: Spreads to small firms widening at 48%
Large/mid C&I also tightening at 45% (broad stress)
ELEVATED: BDC sector at -21.1% discount - private credit stress emerging
